solution_line_template: Three miles at {speed_phase1} miles per hour is {distance_phase1}/{speed_phase1}={time_phase1} hours.
Then, {distance_phase2} miles at {speed_phase2} miles per hour is {distance_phase2}/{speed_phase2}=<<{distance_phase2}/{speed_phase2}={time_phase2}>>{time_phase2} hour.
The last {distance_phase3} miles at {speed_phase3} miles per hour is {distance_phase3}/{speed_phase3}={time_phase3} hour.
In total, it took them {time_phase1} + {time_phase2} + {time_phase3} = <<{time_phase1}+{time_phase2}+{time_phase3}={total_time}>>{total_time} hours to push the car back to town.
